            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: TValue

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:

            The content to which the value should be provided.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Value
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The value to be provided.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Name
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
             Optionally gives a name to the provided value. Descendant components
             will be able to receive the value by specifying this name.
            
             If no name is specified, then descendant components will receive the
             value based the type of value they are requesting.
             </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: IsFixed
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            If true, indicates that <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.CascadingValue`1.Value" /> will not change. This is a
            performance optimization that allows the framework to skip setting up
            change notifications. Set this flag only if you will not change
            <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.CascadingValue`1.Value" /> during the component's lifetime.
            </summary>

TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            A component that supplies route data corresponding to the current navigation state.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: AppAssembly
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the assembly that should be searched for components matching the URI.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: AdditionalAssemblies
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a collection of additional assemblies that should be searched for components
            that can match URIs.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: NotFound
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the content to display when no match is found for the requested route.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Found
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the content to display when a match is found for the requested route.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Navigating
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Get or sets the content to display when asynchronous navigation is in progress.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnNavigateAsync
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a handler that should be called before navigating to a new page.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: PreferExactMatches
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a flag to indicate whether route matching should prefer exact matches
            over wildcards.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            <para>
            Important: all applications should explicitly set this to true. The option to set it to false
            (or leave unset, which defaults to false) is only provided for backward compatibility.
            In .NET 6, this option will be removed and the router will always prefer exact matches.
            </para>
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Context
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the parameter name for all child content expressions.

TagHelpers.Name: Radzen.Blazor.RadzenContextMenu
TagHelpers.Documentation: RadzenContextMenu component. @inject ContextMenuService ContextMenuService <RadzenButton Text="Show context menu" ContextMenu=@(args => ShowContextMenuWithItems(args)) /> @code { void ShowContextMenuWithItems(MouseEventArgs args) { ContextMenuService.Open(args, new List<ContextMenuItem> { new ContextMenuItem() { Text = "Context menu item 1", Value = 1 }, new ContextMenuItem() { Text = "Context menu item 2", Value = 2 }, new ContextMenuItem() { Text = "Context menu item 3", Value = 3 }, }, OnMenuItemClick); } void OnMenuItemClick(MenuItemEventArgs args) { Console.WriteLine($"Menu item with Value={args.Value} clicked"); } }

TagHelpers.Name: Radzen.Blazor.RadzenContextMenu
TagHelpers.Documentation: RadzenContextMenu component. @inject ContextMenuService ContextMenuService <RadzenButton Text="Show context menu" ContextMenu=@(args => ShowContextMenuWithItems(args)) /> @code { void ShowContextMenuWithItems(MouseEventArgs args) { ContextMenuService.Open(args, new List<ContextMenuItem> { new ContextMenuItem() { Text = "Context menu item 1", Value = 1 }, new ContextMenuItem() { Text = "Context menu item 2", Value = 2 }, new ContextMenuItem() { Text = "Context menu item 3", Value = 3 }, }, OnMenuItemClick); } void OnMenuItemClick(MenuItemEventArgs args) { Console.WriteLine($"Menu item with Value={args.Value} clicked"); } }

TagHelpers.Documentation: A validator component which checks if a component value is a valid email address. Must be placed inside a <RadzenTemplateForm TItem="Model" Data=@model> <RadzenTextBox style="display: block" Name="Email" @bind-Value=@model.Email /> <RadzenEmailValidator Component="Email" Style="position: absolute" /> </RadzenTemplateForm> @code { class Model { public string Email { get; set; } } Model model = new Model(); }

TagHelpers.Name: Radzen.Blazor.RadzenEmailValidator
TagHelpers.Documentation: A validator component which checks if a component value is a valid email address. Must be placed inside a <RadzenTemplateForm TItem="Model" Data=@model> <RadzenTextBox style="display: block" Name="Email" @bind-Value=@model.Email /> <RadzenEmailValidator Component="Email" Style="position: absolute" /> </RadzenTemplateForm> @code { class Model { public string Email { get; set; } } Model model = new Model(); }

BoundAttributes.Name: Text
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the message displayed when the component is invalid. Set to <c>"Invalid email"</c> by default.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Component

            </summary>

TagHelpers.Documentation: A validator component which checks if then component value length is within a specified range. Must be placed inside a <RadzenTemplateForm TItem="Model" Data=@model> <RadzenTextBox style="display: block" Name="FirstName" @bind-Value=@model.FirstName /> <RadzenLengthValidator Component="FirstName" Min="3" Text="First name should be at least 3 characters" Style="position: absolute" /> </RadzenTemplateForm> @code { class Model { public string FirstName { get; set; } } Model model = new Model(); }

BoundAttributes.Name: Text
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the message displayed when the component is invalid. Set to <c>"Invalid length"</c> by default.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Min
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the minimum accepted length. The component value length should be greater than the minimum in order to be valid.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Max
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the maximum accepted length. The component value length should be less than the maximum in order to be valid.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Component
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the component which this validator should validate. Must be set to the <see cref="P:Radzen.IRadzenFormComponent.Name" /> of an existing component.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Popup
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Determines if the validator is displayed as a popup or not. Set to <c>false</c> by default.

<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether this <see cref="T:Radzen.Blazor.CartesianSeries`1" /> is visible.
            Invisible series do not appear in the legend and cannot be shown by the user.
            Use the <c>Visible</c> property to programatically show or hide a series.
            </summary>
            <value><c>true</c> if visible; otherwise, <c>false</c>.</value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Hidden
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether this <see cref="T:Radzen.Blazor.CartesianSeries`1" /> is hidden.
            Hidden series are initially invisible and the user can show them by clicking on their label in the legend.
            Use the <c>Hidden</c> property to hide certain series from your users but still allow them to see them.
            </summary>
            <value><c>true</c> if hidden; otherwise, <c>false</c>.</value>

TagHelpers.Name: Radzen.Blazor.RadzenLogin
TagHelpers.Documentation: RadzenLogin component. Must be placed in RadzenTemplateForm. <RadzenTemplateForm Data=@("Login")> <RadzenLogin AllowRegister="true" AllowResetPassword="true" Login=@OnLogin ResetPassword=@OnResetPassword Register=@OnRegister /> </RadzenTemplateForm> @code { void OnLogin(LoginArgs args, string name) { Console.WriteLine($"{name} -> Username: {args.Username} and password: {args.Password}"); } void OnRegister(string name) { Console.WriteLine($"{name} -> Register"); } void OnResetPassword(string value, string name) { Console.WriteLine($"{name} -> ResetPassword for user: {value}"); } }

TagHelpers.Name: Radzen.Blazor.RadzenMediaQuery
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
             RadzenMediaQuery fires its <see cref="P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenMediaQuery.Change" /> event when the media query specified via <see cref="P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenMediaQuery.Query" /> matches or not.
             </summary>
             <example>
             < RadzenMediaQuery Query="(max-width: 768px)" Change=@OnChange />
             @code {
              void OnChange(bool matches)
              {
                 // matches is true if the media query applies; otherwise false.
              }
            }
             </example>

            </summary>

            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: TItem
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the type of the type parameter TItem for the Radzen.Blazor.RadzenPieSeries<TItem> component.

BoundAttributes.Name: X
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the x coordinate of the pie center. Not set by default which centers pie horizontally.
            </summary>
            <value>The x.</value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Y
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the y coordinate of the pie center. Not set by default which centers pie vertically.
            </summary>
            <value>The y.</value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Radius
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the radius of the pie. Not set by default - the pie takes as much size of the chart as possible.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Fills
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The fill colors of the pie segments. Used as the background of the segments.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Strokes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The stroke colors of the pie segments.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: StrokeWidth
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The stroke width of the segments in pixels. By default set to <c>0</c>.
            </summary>
            <value>The width of the stroke.</value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Visible
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether this <see cref="T:Radzen.Blazor.CartesianSeries`1" /> is visible.
            Invisible series do not appear in the legend and cannot be shown by the user.
            Use the <c>Visible</c> property to programatically show or hide a series.
            </summary>
            <value><c>true</c> if visible; otherwise, <c>false</c>.</value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Hidden
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether this <see cref="T:Radzen.Blazor.CartesianSeries`1" /> is hidden.
            Hidden series are initially invisible and the user can show them by clicking on their label in the legend.
            Use the <c>Hidden</c> property to hide certain series from your users but still allow them to see them.
            </summary>
            <value><c>true</c> if hidden; otherwise, <c>false</c>.</value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueProperty
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>

            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: AppointmentSelect
BoundAttributes.Documentation: A callback that will be invoked when the user clicks an appointment in the current view. Commonly used to edit existing appointments. <RadzenScheduler Data=@appointments AppointmentSelect=@OnAppointmentSelect> </RadzenScheduler> @code { void OnAppointmentSelect(SchedulerAppointmentSelectEventArgs<TItem> args) { } }

BoundAttributes.Name: AppointmentRender
BoundAttributes.Documentation: An action that will be invoked when the current view renders an appointment. Never call StateHasChanged when handling AppointmentRender. <RadzenScheduler Data=@appointments AppointmentRender=@OnAppointmentRendert> </RadzenScheduler> @code { void OnAppintmentRender(SchedulerAppointmentRenderEventArgs<TItem> args) { if (args.Data.Text == "Birthday") { args.Attributes["style"] = "color: red;" } . } }

BoundAttributes.Name: SlotRender
BoundAttributes.Documentation: An action that will be invoked when the current view renders an slot. Never call StateHasChanged when handling SlotRender. <RadzenScheduler Data=@appointments SlotRender=@OnSlotRender> </RadzenScheduler> @code { void OnSlotRender(SchedulerSlotRenderEventArgs args) { if (args.View.Text == "Month" && args.Start.Date == DateTime.Today) { args.Attributes["style"] = "background: red;"; } } }

            expanded on larger displays and collapsed on touch devices. Set to <c>false</c> if you want to disable this behavior.
            Responsive mode is only available when RadzenSidebar is inside <see cref="T:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenLayout" />.
            </summary>

TagHelpers.Documentation: A component which represents a form. Provides validation support. <RadzenTemplateForm TItem="Model" Data=@model> <RadzenTextBox style="display: block" Name="Email" @bind-Value=@model.Email /> <RadzenRequiredValidator Component="Email" Text="Email is required" Style="position: absolute" /> </RadzenTemplateForm> @code { class Model { public string Email { get; set; } } Model model = new Model(); }

BoundAttributes.Name: TItem
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the type of the type parameter TItem for the Radzen.Blazor.RadzenTemplateForm<TItem> component.

BoundAttributes.Name: Data
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the model of the form. Required to support validation.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the child content.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Submit
BoundAttributes.Documentation: A callback that will be invoked when the user submits the form and is true. <RadzenTemplateForm TItem="Model" Submit=@OnSubmit Data=@model> <RadzenTextBox style="display: block" Name="Email" @bind-Value=@model.Email /> <RadzenRequiredValidator Component="Email" Text="Email is required" Style="position: absolute" /> </RadzenTemplateForm> @code { class Model { public string Email { get; set; } } Model model = new Model(); void OnSubmit(Model value) { } }

BoundAttributes.Name: OnInvalidSubmit
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Obsolete. Use <see cref="P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenTemplateForm`1.InvalidSubmit" /> instead.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: InvalidSubmit
BoundAttributes.Documentation: A callback that will be invoked when the user submits the form and is false. <RadzenTemplateForm TItem="Model" InvalidSubmit=@OnInvalidSubmit Data=@model> <RadzenTextBox style="display: block" Name="Email" @bind-Value=@model.Email /> <RadzenRequiredValidator Component="Email" Text="Email is required" Style="position: absolute" /> </RadzenTemplateForm> @code { class Model { public string Email { get; set; } } Model model = new Model(); void OnInvalidSubmit(FormInvalidSubmitEventArgs args) { } }

BoundAttributes.Name: Method
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the form method attribute. Used together with . <RadzenTemplateForm TItem="Model" Method="post" Action="/register" Data=@model> <RadzenTextBox style="display: block" Name="Email" @bind-Value=@model.Email /> <RadzenRequiredValidator Component="Email" Text="Email is required" Style="position: absolute" /> </RadzenTemplateForm>

BoundAttributes.Name: Action
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the form action attribute. When set the form submits to the specified URL. <RadzenTemplateForm TItem="Model" Method="post" Action="/register" Data=@model> <RadzenTextBox style="display: block" Name="Email" @bind-Value=@model.Email /> <RadzenRequiredValidator Component="Email" Text="Email is required" Style="position: absolute" /> </RadzenTemplateForm>

TagHelpers.Name: Radzen.Blazor.RadzenTemplateForm<TItem>
TagHelpers.Documentation: A component which represents a form. Provides validation support. <RadzenTemplateForm TItem="Model" Data=@model> <RadzenTextBox style="display: block" Name="Email" @bind-Value=@model.Email /> <RadzenRequiredValidator Component="Email" Text="Email is required" Style="position: absolute" /> </RadzenTemplateForm> @code { class Model { public string Email { get; set; } } Model model = new Model(); }

BoundAttributes.Name: TItem
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the type of the type parameter TItem for the Radzen.Blazor.RadzenTemplateForm<TItem> component.

BoundAttributes.Name: Data
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the model of the form. Required to support validation.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the child content.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Submit
BoundAttributes.Documentation: A callback that will be invoked when the user submits the form and is true. <RadzenTemplateForm TItem="Model" Submit=@OnSubmit Data=@model> <RadzenTextBox style="display: block" Name="Email" @bind-Value=@model.Email /> <RadzenRequiredValidator Component="Email" Text="Email is required" Style="position: absolute" /> </RadzenTemplateForm> @code { class Model { public string Email { get; set; } } Model model = new Model(); void OnSubmit(Model value) { } }

BoundAttributes.Name: OnInvalidSubmit
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Obsolete. Use <see cref="P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenTemplateForm`1.InvalidSubmit" /> instead.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: InvalidSubmit
BoundAttributes.Documentation: A callback that will be invoked when the user submits the form and is false. <RadzenTemplateForm TItem="Model" InvalidSubmit=@OnInvalidSubmit Data=@model> <RadzenTextBox style="display: block" Name="Email" @bind-Value=@model.Email /> <RadzenRequiredValidator Component="Email" Text="Email is required" Style="position: absolute" /> </RadzenTemplateForm> @code { class Model { public string Email { get; set; } } Model model = new Model(); void OnInvalidSubmit(FormInvalidSubmitEventArgs args) { } }

BoundAttributes.Name: Method
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the form method attribute. Used together with . <RadzenTemplateForm TItem="Model" Method="post" Action="/register" Data=@model> <RadzenTextBox style="display: block" Name="Email" @bind-Value=@model.Email /> <RadzenRequiredValidator Component="Email" Text="Email is required" Style="position: absolute" /> </RadzenTemplateForm>

BoundAttributes.Name: Action
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the form action attribute. When set the form submits to the specified URL. <RadzenTemplateForm TItem="Model" Method="post" Action="/register" Data=@model> <RadzenTextBox style="display: block" Name="Email" @bind-Value=@model.Email /> <RadzenRequiredValidator Component="Email" Text="Email is required" Style="position: absolute" /> </RadzenTemplateForm>

TagHelpers.Name: Attributes
TagHelpers.Documentation: Merges a collection of attributes into the current element or component.

BoundAttributes.Name: @attributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Merges a collection of attributes into the current element or component.

TagHelpers.Name: Bind
TagHelpers.Documentation: Binds the provided expression to an attribute and a change event, based on the naming of the bind attribute. For example: @bind-value="..." and @bind-value:event="onchange" will assign the current value of the expression to the 'value' attribute, and assign a delegate that attempts to set the value to the 'onchange' attribute.

BoundAttributes.Name: @bind-...
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Binds the provided expression to an attribute and a change event, based on the naming of the bind attribute. For example: @bind-value="..." and @bind-value:event="onchange" will assign the current value of the expression to the 'value' attribute, and assign a delegate that attempts to set the value to the 'onchange' attribute.

BoundAttributeParameters.Name: format
BoundAttributeParameters.Documentation: Specifies a format to convert the value specified by the corresponding bind attribute. For example: @bind-value:format="..." will apply a format string to the value specified in @bind-value="...". The format string can currently only be used with expressions of type DateTime.

BoundAttributeParameters.Name: event
BoundAttributeParameters.Documentation: Specifies the event handler name to attach for change notifications for the value provided by the '@bind-...' attribute.

BoundAttributeParameters.Name: culture
BoundAttributeParameters.Documentation: Specifies the culture to use for conversions.
